messages.message:
Hey team! I have a question about using the `TableGrid` component from Pollen.
I'm implementing filters in a table with a “Show more” button. The button currently shows based on the total number of rows before filtering:

```const allRows = [
  { type: 'Text', field: 'name' },
  { type: 'Text', field: 'address' },
  { type: 'List', field: 'items' },
  // ... total of 15 rows
];```
We show “Show more” if `allRows.length > 10`.

However, filtering (e.g. only showing rows with `type === 'List'`) is handled internally by the `TableGrid` component. So even if the filtered result only has 3 rows, we’re still showing the “Show more” button — because we’re checking `allRows.length`, not the number of rows actually rendered.

Is there a way to access the number of _currently rendered_ (i.e., filtered) rows from the `TableGrid` component so we can conditionally show the “Show more” button only when it makes sense?

Or... if we are already allowing `search`, and now adding filtering. Do we need the show more button?

For this table.

> if we are already allowing `search`, and now adding filtering. Do we need the show more button?
we do need the "Show more" button since there could be max 100 fields in a class

however, we want to show max 10 fields per class -> otherwise you would only see the first class and not see the later classes in this table

i also don't see a way to get the list of filtered rows from `TableGrid` since the filters are handled internally inside `TableGrid` via `useReactTable`, which is imported from `@tanstack/react-table`

it is possible to add a prop to `TableGrid` to return the list of filtered subrows

but now that i'm thinking about it, i think it's ok to not show this column filter (it currently doesn't exist for the single-class fields table)

this could be something that we add later on - feel free to create a ticket to track in our backlog
Okay, it seems as if we are currently not showing 10 fields per class, just 10 fields in total (or whatever the max amount is).
To show 10 fields per class, I would expect the `Show More` button to appear as a child of the Class row itself. I believe this would require some modifications to the pollen table component itself?

we discussed this in the case management sync with Jack
• no need to show the "Show more" button on this page
• let's not add the column filter rn
    ◦ we can add this later after data type support
